events.originalText: In the Venezuelan parliamentary election, the ruling United Socialist Party lost control of the National Assembly for the first time in 16 years.
events.subtitle: 2015 Venezuelan parliamentary election
events.headline: United Socialist Party loses control of National Assembly in Venezuelan parliamentary election

events.originalText: An Iranian Lockheed C-130 transport aircraft crashed into a ten-floor apartment building in a residential area of Tehran, killing over 100 people.
events.subtitle: Lockheed C-130 Hercules
events.headline: Iranian Lockheed C-130 crashes into apartment building in Tehran, killing over 100

events.originalText: The Recording Industry Association of America filed a lawsuit against the peer-to-peer file sharing network Napster, alleging that the service facilitated widespread copyright infringement.
events.subtitle: Recording Industry Association of America
events.headline: Recording Industry Association of America sues Napster for copyright infringement

events.originalText: The Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, India, was demolished by Hindu Kar Sevaks, who believed that it was built on the birthplace of Rama.
events.subtitle: Babri Masjid
events.headline: Babri Masjid in Ayodhya, India, demolished by Hindu Kar Sevaks

events.originalText: An Italian Air Force military jet, abandoned by its pilot after an on-board fire, crashed into a high school near Bologna, killing 12 students and injuring 88 other people.
events.subtitle: Italian Air Force
events.headline: Italian Air Force jet crashes into high school near Bologna, killing 12 students

events.originalText: Claiming to be "fighting feminism", 25-year-old Marc Lépine killed fourteen women before committing suicide at the École Polytechnique in Montreal, Canada.
events.subtitle: Marc Lépine
events.headline: Marc Lépine kills fourteen women at École Polytechnique in Montreal

events.originalText: Self-government was granted to the Australian Capital Territory.
events.subtitle: History of the Australian Capital Territory
events.headline: Australian Capital Territory granted self-government

events.originalText: The Irish National Liberation Army exploded a time bomb in Ballykelly, Northern Ireland, killing eleven British Army soldiers and six civilians.
events.subtitle: Irish National Liberation Army
events.headline: Irish National Liberation Army kills eleven British soldiers in Ballykelly bombing

events.originalText: Four members of the Provisional Irish Republican Army took two people hostage in a house on Balcombe Street in London, surrendering six days later.
events.subtitle: Provisional Irish Republican Army
events.headline: Provisional IRA members surrender after hostage situation in London

events.originalText: American physician Adrian Kantrowitz and his team performed the world's first pediatric heart transplant at Maimonides Medical Center in New York City.
events.subtitle: Adrian Kantrowitz
events.headline: World's first pediatric heart transplant performed in New York City

events.originalText: The first U.S. attempt to launch a satellite failed with an explosion on the launch pad at Cape Canaveral.
events.subtitle: Vanguard TV-3
events.headline: First U.S. satellite launch attempt fails with explosion at Cape Canaveral

events.originalText: In what became known as the "Blood in the Water" match at the Melbourne Olympics, the Hungarian water polo team defeated the USSR 4–0 against the background of the Hungarian Revolution.
events.subtitle: Blood in the Water match
events.headline: Hungarian water polo team defeats USSR in "Blood in the Water" match at Melbourne Olympics

events.originalText: At the Melbourne Olympics, 14-year-old swimmer Sandra Morgan became the youngest Australian to win an Olympic gold medal.
events.subtitle: 1956 Summer Olympics
events.headline: 14-year-old Sandra Morgan wins Olympic gold at Melbourne Olympics

events.originalText: The Holocaust: Members of German Ordnungspolizei massacred 31 people in occupied Poland for helping Jews.
events.subtitle: The Holocaust
events.headline: German Ordnungspolizei massacre 31 people in occupied Poland for helping Jews

events.originalText: The British Secret Intelligence Service established a facility known as Camp X (pictured) in Ontario, Canada, to train covert agents in clandestine operations.
events.subtitle: MI6
events.headline: British Secret Intelligence Service establishes Camp X in Canada for covert agent training

events.originalText: In United States v. One Book Called Ulysses  Judge John M. Woolsey ruled that James Joyce's novel Ulysses was not obscene, allowing it to be imported into the United States.
events.subtitle: United States v. One Book Called Ulysses
events.headline: Judge rules James Joyce's Ulysses not obscene in United States v. One Book Called Ulysses

events.originalText: A ship in Halifax Harbour, Nova Scotia, Canada, carrying TNT and picric acid caught fire after a collision with another ship and caused the second-largest man-made accidental explosion in history.
events.subtitle: Halifax Harbour
events.headline: Explosion in Halifax Harbour causes second-largest man-made accidental explosion in history

events.originalText: World War I: USS Jacob Jones became the first American destroyer to be sunk by enemy action when it was torpedoed by German submarine SM U-53.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: USS Jacob Jones sunk by German submarine in World War I

events.originalText: The Nefertiti Bust, listed among the "Top 10 Plundered Artifacts" by Time, was found in Amarna, Egypt, before being taken to Germany.
events.subtitle: Nefertiti Bust
events.headline: Nefertiti Bust found in Amarna, Egypt, listed among "Top 10 Plundered Artifacts"

events.originalText: A mine explosion in Monongah, West Virginia, killed 362 people and led to the establishment of the United States Bureau of Mines.
events.subtitle: Monongah mining disaster
events.headline: Mine explosion in West Virginia kills 362, leads to establishment of U.S. Bureau of Mines

events.originalText: President Theodore Roosevelt announced the Roosevelt Corollary to the Monroe Doctrine, justifying the exercise of "international police power" by the U.S. in the Western Hemisphere.
events.subtitle: Theodore Roosevelt
events.headline: President Theodore Roosevelt announces Roosevelt Corollary to Monroe Doctrine

events.originalText: Slavery in the United States was officially abolished when the Thirteenth Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified.
events.subtitle: Slavery in the United States
events.headline: Thirteenth Amendment officially abolishes slavery in the United States

events.originalText: Mexican–American War: American and Mexican forces clashed at the Battle of San Pasqual, a series of skirmishes near San Diego, California.
events.subtitle: Mexican–American War
events.headline: American and Mexican forces clash at Battle of San Pasqual in Mexican-American War

events.originalText: Haitian Revolution: Nearly all the final French ships in Haiti were captured by the Royal Navy when they attempted to evade the blockade of Saint-Domingue.
events.subtitle: Haitian Revolution
events.headline: Royal Navy captures final French ships in Haiti during Haitian Revolution

events.originalText: After days of bombardment,  Mongol invaders under Batu Khan breached the walls of Kiev and plundered the city, slaughtering its inhabitants.
events.subtitle: Mongol invasion of Kievan Rus'
events.headline: Mongol invaders breach walls of Kiev, slaughtering inhabitants

events.originalText: Béla I (pictured) was crowned King of Hungary in Székesfehérvár.
events.subtitle: Béla I of Hungary
events.headline: Béla I crowned King of Hungary in Székesfehérvár

events.originalText: Leo VIII was ordained a bishop, claiming the Holy See as an antipope supported by Otto the Great.
events.subtitle: Pope Leo VIII
events.headline: Leo VIII ordained as bishop, claiming Holy See as antipope supported by Otto the Great
